intro: Fagara okinawensis, commonly known as the Okinawa fagara, is a rare shrub native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in late spring, followed by small, dark blue berries. Fagara okinawensis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is typically found in secondary forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
